article.headline: Bradley 82, Loyola (IL) 73
article.story: PEORIA, Ill. (AP) -- Jeremy Crouch was 8-for-8 from the free-throw line and finished with 21 points as Bradley beat Loyola of Chicago 82-73 Tuesday night. Daniel Ruffin scored 19 points for the Braves (8-3), Matt Salley added 18 off the bench and Will Franklin had 17 -- including five 3-pointers. J.R. Blount led Loyola of Chicago (8-4) with 17 points, while Andy Polka had 12. Blake Schilb scored 11 and pulled down a game-high nine rebounds for the Ramblers, who turned the ball over 22 times in the game, including 18 in the first half. Bradley, which won its 13th straight home game, was outrebounded 39-33 for the game but its 12 3-pointers doubled the Ramblers' effort from behind the arc.
